combine.translation[0].definitions[0].de: if you combine two or more different things, or if they combine, they begin to exist or work together
combine.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: Ruth hesitated, uncertain of how to combine honesty and diplomacy in her answer.
The combined effects of the war and the drought resulted in famine.
Augustine was later to combine elements of this philosophy with the teachings of Christianity.
Diets are most effective when combined with exercise.
A number of factors have combined to create this difficult situation.
combine.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to have two or more different features or qualities at the same time
combine.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: Good carpet wool needs to combine softness with strength.
combine.translation[0].definitions[2].de: if two or more different substances combine, or if you combine them, they mix or join together to produce a new single substance
combine.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: Combine all the ingredients in a large bowl.
Different amino acids combine to form proteins.
Steel is produced by combining iron with carbon.
combine.translation[0].definitions[3].de: to do two different activities at the same time
combine.translation[0].definitions[3].no: combine business with pleasure (=work and enjoy yourself at the same time)
combine.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: Many people enjoy combining a holiday with learning a new skill.
the problems facing women who wish to combine a career and family
combine.translation[0].definitions[4].de: if two or more groups, organizations etc combine, or if you combine them, they join or work together in order to do something
combine.translation[0].definitions[4].ex: University zoologists and government vets are combining forces  (=working together) to investigate the disease.

combine.translation[1].definitions[0].de: a machine used by farmers to cut grain, separate the seeds from it, and clean it
combine.translation[1].definitions[1].de: a group of people, businesses etc who work together
combine.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: The factory was sold to a British combine after the war.
combine.translation[2].definitions[0].de: if two or more groups or organizations combine, or if you combine them, they join together
combine.translation[2].definitions[0].ex: They said they expect no job losses from combining their operations.
